def_cn: 为…提供服务;满足…的需要;接待
def_en: In British English, to cater for a group of people means to provide all the things that they need or want. In American English, you say you cater to a person or group of people.
In British English, to cater for something means to take it into account. In American English, you say you cater to something.

def_cn: 为…提供饮食;承办…的酒席
def_en: See also:catering; selfcatering; If a person or company caters for an occasion such as a wedding or a party, they provide food and drink for all the people there.
